# Blumatix Intelligence (majority stake held by CSS Group)

Blumatix Intelligence is an intelligent document processing provider offering AI-powered document and invoice capture through its BLU DELTA platform, with majority ownership by CSS Group since February 2025.

![Blumatix](assets/blumatix.png)

## Overview

Blumatix specializes in automated document understanding for cross-enterprise information exchange. Founded in 2016 and headquartered in Salzburg, Austria, the company develops AI solutions that enable automated processing of business documents without requiring standardization or manual intervention. BLU DELTA processes over 25 million documents annually for international corporations and mid-sized enterprises. In February 2025, CSS Group acquired a majority stake in Blumatix Intelligence.

## Key Features

- **BLU DELTA**: Core platform for invoice and document capture using AI
- **Automated Document Understanding**: Interprets business documents without rigid standardization requirements
- **Cross-Enterprise Processing**: Facilitates information exchange between companies
- **Partner Integration**: Solutions designed for integration into partner products
- **ISO 27001 Certification**: Security and information management compliance

## Use Cases

### Automated Invoice Processing

Accounting departments receive invoices from suppliers in varying formats including PDF, scanned images, and electronic documents. Blumatix extracts invoice numbers, dates, line items, and totals regardless of layout or structure. The platform validates extracted data against purchase orders and routes approved invoices to ERP systems while flagging discrepancies for review.

### Inter-Company Document Exchange

Organizations exchanging business documents including orders, delivery notes, and statements replace manual data entry with automated processing. Blumatix interprets document content and structure using AI, extracting relevant information and formatting it for receiving systems. This approach eliminates the need for trading partners to adopt standardized electronic document formats.
